cmCourseInfo.description: This course will introduce students to key terms, theories, and debates in Queer and Religious Studies and to the history of queer identities as they are expressed within various religious traditions, texts, and communities. It asks how dominant heteronormative discourses on gender and sexuality are adhered to, legitimized, negotiated, and contested within various religious traditions. The course will also allow students to interrogate how power and power relationships are shaped by sex, gender, sexuality, race, ethnicity, class, age, and ability in the world of religion.
cmCourseInfo.title: Queer Religion and Religiosities
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Completion of 4.0 credits including a 0.5 credit in SDS/ RLG
publicationSections: Sexual Diversity Studies, Mark S. Bonham Centre for
